chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court ordered unpaid obligations be reduced to a civil judgment.

The court indicated that the jail sentence was time served. 
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven P. Dollarhyde Jr.
Current: 1611 Western Ave Lot 42, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 01-17-2017)
Prior: 50 E Spruce St, Chippewa County Jail, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States
REVOKED - SENTENCED TO CO. JAIL/HOC

Defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde in court by video conference with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding his appearance by video conference. Defendant has no objection to appearing by video conference.   Mr. Dollarhyde and his attorney have no corrections to the revocation packet.  Attorney Tlusty puts agreement into the record.  Court orders 6 months county jail with huber on each count concurrent to each other and any other sentence defendant is serving.  139 days sentence credit.  Unpaid court obligations are reduced to a civil judgment.  Court informs defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.  - rt
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Cost Summary

Defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim notification has been complied with.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 1 to possession of THC 961.41(3g)(e) and amended count 3 to operate motor vehicle without owner's consent - 943.23(3m).  Plea of no contest to amended charges.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and Count 3.  Statement by counsel.   Court orders withheld sentence placed on probation for two years with conditions of court costs on each count; $433.00 costs to Taylor County Sheriff's Department; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; count 3 only letter of apology due within 30 days of plea and sentencing and preapproved by probation.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Defendant Steven P. Dollarhyde in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Cody Kowalczyk sworn and examined.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to all three charges reserve right of defense to dismiss counts 1 and 2.  Attorney Kelz would like court to review cash bond.  Argument by counsel.  Court will not amend the cash bond.   - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties.   Attorney Kelz is requesting that the bond be modified to a $500.00 cash bond.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court will not modify bond.  Defendant would like a timely preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.  - rt

for Steven P. Dollarhyde Jr.

Defendant shall have no contact with T.B.B.-dob: 02-08-1952. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking; no contact with T.B.B.-dob: 2-8-52; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for April 12, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. -ba
